title: What is the Secret to Spiritual Enlightenment According to Mystical Christianity and Islam?
first_phrase: In the following text, the author delves into the concept of the "duality of the self" as a key element in attaining spiritual enlightenment. The text describes the process of creating an "other" within oneself, and engaging in internal dialogues with this "other" to gain deeper understanding and control of one's instincts, thoughts, and emotions. This method is explored in both mystical and magical paths, which differ in their approach to transforming the self. While mystical paths create an "other" that remains distinct from the self, magical paths seek to invert the self and the other. The text concludes with the idea of the self being transformed into a feminine aspect, one that is dedicated to the divine in a moment of complete devotion.
content: Nel mistico la mente crea un «altro», che però resta «altro» (il Maestro, il «Cristo» da imitare, quando non anche la stessa immagine della Divinità). last_phrase: In conclusion, the path of mysticism requires the mortification of the self in a desire to reach the divine. The search for the "other" can lead to the creation of an image of divinity to follow, but ultimately, true transformation requires a complete surrender to God with pure faith and love. However, this path has its imperfections, including the difficulty in transcending the duality of love and achieving true transformation in the "other."
